ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk38:0.2_0: The monks’ rules and their analysis
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk38:0.5_0: 38. The training rule on finding fault
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk38:1.1_0: At one time when the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in the Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery,
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk38:1.2_0: At that time the monks from the group of six were looking at the bowls of others finding fault. ...
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk38:1.3.1_0: “‘I will not look at another’s almsbowl finding fault,’ this is how you should train.”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk38:1.4_0: One should not look at the bowl of another finding fault.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk38:1.5_0: If a monk, out of disrespect, looks at the bowl of another finding fault, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk38:1.7.4_0: if he looks with the intention of giving or getting someone to give;
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk38:1.7.5_0: if he is not finding fault;
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk38:1.7.6_0: They burn in times of trouble,
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk38:1.10_0: The eighth rule, the training rule on weavers, is finished.
